page.title: 13REDHOUSE FARM INTERVIEW
page.content: The farm is owned by Mr&Mrs Templeman, who have lived there for 3 years.They have 180 acres of land,which is used for cereal crops.They had pigs until 1984 when they were slaughtered because they had Arjeskies disease,but they are restocking with different breeds and also fattening cattle later this year.Present livestock-2 donkeys,1 pony and 1 goat. The house was built in 1450 and still retains many original features e.g.windows. Both the house and the nearby barn are listed buildings. The barn has interesting old beams and was originally thatched but now has Suffolk pantiles. 1980's- Mr Templeman feels there is a great uncertainty in farming due to the surpluses caused by too great an efficiency for consumption.
